verses.verse: Listen <S%H8085><s%> now to what Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> says: <S%H559><s%> "Arise, <S%H6965><s%> plead <S%H7378><s%> your case before the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and let the hills <S%H1389><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> what you have to say. <S%H6963><s%>

For I brought you up <S%H5927><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and redeemed <S%H6299><s%> you out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of bondage. <S%H5650><s%> I sent <S%H7971><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you Moses, <S%H4872><s%> Aaron, <S%H175><s%> and Miriam. <S%H4813><s%>

How shall I come before <S%H6923><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and bow <S%H3721><s%> myself before the exalted <S%H4791><s%> God? <S%H430><s%> Shall I come before <S%H6923><s%> him with burnt offerings, <S%H5930><s%> with calves <S%H5695><s%> a year <S%H8141><s%> old? <S%H1121><s%>

Will Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> be pleased <S%H7521><s%> with thousands <S%H505><s%> of rams? <S%H352><s%> With tens of thousands <S%H7233><s%> of rivers <S%H5158><s%> of oil? <S%H8081><s%> Shall I give <S%H5414><s%> my firstborn <S%H1060><s%> for my disobedience? <S%H6588><s%> The fruit <S%H6529><s%> of my body <S%H990><s%> for the sin <S%H2403><s%> of my soul? <S%H5315><s%>

He has shown <S%H5046><s%> you, <S%H120><s%> O man, what is good. <S%H2896><s%> What does Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> require <S%H1875><s%> of you, <S%H6213><s%> but to act justly, <S%H4941><s%> to love <S%H160><s%> mercy, <S%H2617><s%> and to walk <S%H3212><s%> humbly <S%H6800><s%> with your God? <S%H430><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%>'s voice <S%H6963><s%> calls <S%H7121><s%> to the city, <S%H5892><s%> and wisdom <S%H8454><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> your name: <S%H8034><s%> "Listen <S%H8085><s%> to the rod, <S%H4294><s%> and he who appointed it. <S%H3259><s%>

Shall I be pure <S%H2135><s%> with dishonest <S%H7562><s%> scales, <S%H3976><s%> and with a bag <S%H3599><s%> of deceitful <S%H4820><s%> weights? <S%H68><s%>

Her rich men <S%H6223><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of violence, <S%H2555><s%> her inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> lies, <S%H8267><s%> and their tongue <S%H3956><s%> is deceitful <S%H7423><s%> in their speech. <S%H6310><s%>
Therefore I also have struck <S%H2470><s%> you with a grievous wound. <S%H5221><s%> I have made you desolate <S%H8074><s%> because of your sins. <S%H2403><s%>

You shall eat, <S%H398><s%> but not be satisfied. <S%H7646><s%> Your humiliation <S%H3445><s%> will be in your midst. <S%H7130><s%> You will store up, <S%H5253><s%> but not save; <S%H6403><s%> and that which you save <S%H6403><s%> I will give up <S%H5414><s%> to the sword. <S%H2719><s%>

You will sow, <S%H2232><s%> but won't <S%H7114><s%> reap. You will tread <S%H1869><s%> the olives, <S%H2132><s%> but won't <S%H5480><s%> anoint yourself with oil; <S%H8081><s%> and crush grapes, <S%H8492><s%> but won't <S%H8354><s%> drink the wine. <S%H8492><s%>

For the statutes <S%H2708><s%> of Omri <S%H6018><s%> are kept, <S%H8104><s%> and all the works <S%H4639><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Ahab. <S%H256><s%> You walk <S%H3212><s%> in their counsels, <S%H4156><s%> that I may make <S%H5414><s%> you a ruin, <S%H8047><s%> and her inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> a hissing; <S%H8322><s%> And you will bear <S%H5375><s%> the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of my people. <S%H5971><s%>"
